@mjsax - regarding this: 
>Any thought about this:

>This RS raised the thought, that our standby task configuration is rather "all or nothing". Do you think it would make sense to allow a more fine grained configuration? I.e., allow to specify the number of standby replicas individually for each stateful operator?

We probably need a wider discussion on this.

@ijuma Looks good to me.

I think this feature allows two SASL_SSL listeners, one for external and one for internal and the two can use different mechanisms and different JAAS contexts. That makes the multi-mechanism configuration neater. I think it will be useful to have an integration test for this, perhaps change `SaslMultiMechanismConsumerTest`. What do you think? If it is a big change, then perhaps it is not worthwhile.

Test PASSed (JDK 8 and Scala 2.12).

It makes me a bit uneasy just dropping the null records as it might mask bugs in user code. My preference would be:
1. In this PR consistently throw exceptions.
2. In another PR make it configurable
One additional thing: it would be good to mention in `NodeApiVersions`'s class Javadoc that it's an internal class.

Review by @guozhangwang.

2 things: can we add a 1 sentence description to the JIRA? And is it common to test clients that support security with an unit/integration test? @ijuma you don't need to write the test, just wondering what best practices for testing this are. Thanks.

Refer to this link for build results (access rights to CI server needed): 
https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-pr-jdk7-scala2.10/1233/
Test FAILed (JDK 7 and Scala 2.10).

@rajinisivaram, I think it's a bit tricky to support multiple listeners in `KafkaServerTestHarness`. Maybe it's easier to do the test you suggest in `MultipleListenersWithSameSecurityProtocolTest`. Would it be OK if I file a JIRA so that it's done as a follow-up?

Refer to this link for build results (access rights to CI server needed): 
https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-pr-jdk8-scala2.11/1235/
Test PASSed (JDK 8 and Scala 2.11).

@enothereska, I updated the JIRA (with more than one sentence :)). There should be integration tests for Streams and security yes. @guozhangwang said that there's a JIRA for it. In the absence of those, I wrote a unit test that verifies that the security configs are now being passed (it's easy to modify the code to verify that they were not being passed before).
By the way, a future improvement is to allow the admin client configs to be namespaced like the producer and consumer configs can be namespaced currently.
@enothereska @mjsax @guozhangwang

```java
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at kafka.api.ConsumerBounceTest.checkClosedState(ConsumerBounceTest.scala:356)
	at kafka.api.ConsumerBounceTest.checkCloseWithCoordinatorFailure(ConsumerBounceTest.scala:208)
	at kafka.api.ConsumerBounceTest.testClose(ConsumerBounceTest.scala:171)
```
